}} 'Ethyl carbamate' (also called 'urethane') is a chemical compound with the
molecular formula C 3H 7NO 2 first prepared in the
nineteenth century. Structurally, it is an ester of carbamic acid. Despite its
common name, it is not a component of polyurethanes.
